text:
What is printed?
let x = 5;
console.log(x + 3);

What is the value of the expression?
5 == "5"

answerDetail: x == 5 is false, but x > 1 is true.
JavaScript division always produces a floating-point result.
x > 5 is the first true condition.

text:
What is printed?
let a = true;
console.log(!a);

Which value will be printed?
let x = 3 * 2 - 1;
console.log(x);
